verses.verse: The word<WH1697> that came to Jeremiah<WH3414> from Jehovah<WH3068>, saying<WH559>,
Thus speaketh<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, Write<WH3789> thee all the words<WH1697> that I have spoken<WH1696> unto thee in a book<WH5612>.

For <WH3117>, lo, the days come<WH935>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>, that I will turn again<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063>, saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>; and I will cause them to return<WH7725> to the land<WH776> that I gave<WH5414> to their fathers<WH1>, and they shall possess it<WH3423>.
And these are the words<WH1697> that Jehovah<WH3068> spake<WH1696> concerning Israel<WH3478> and concerning Judah<WH3063>.
For thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: We have heard<WH8085> a voice<WH6963> of trembling<WH2731>, of fear<WH6343>, and not of peace<WH7965>.

Ask <WH7592> ye now<WH7200>, and see whether a man<WH2145> doth travail with child<WH3205>: wherefore do I see<WH7200> every man<WH1397> with his hands<WH3027> on his loins<WH2504>, as a woman in travail<WH3205>, and all faces<WH6440> are turned<WH2015> into paleness<WH3420>?
Alas <WH1945>! for that day<WH3117> is great<WH1419>, so that<WH369> none is like it<WH6256>: it is even the time of Jacob<WH3290>'s trouble<WH6869>; but he shall be saved out of it<WH3467>.

And it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, that I will break<WH7665> his yoke<WH5923> from off thy neck<WH6677>, and will burst<WH5423> thy bonds<WH4147>; and strangers<WH2114> shall no more make him their bondman<WH5647>;
but they shall serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068> their God<WH430>, and David<WH1732> their king<WH4428>, whom I will raise up unto them<WH6965>.

Therefore fear<WH3372> thou not<WH3290>, O Jacob my servant<WH5650>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; neither be dismayed<WH2865>, O Israel<WH3478>: for<WH3467>, lo, I will save thee from afar<WH7350>, and thy seed<WH2233> from the land<WH776> of their captivity<WH7628>; and Jacob<WH3290> shall return<WH7725>, and shall be quiet<WH8252> and at ease<WH7599>, and none shall make him afraid<WH2729>.

For I am with thee<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>, to save<WH3467> thee<WH6213>: for I will make a full end<WH3617> of all the nations<WH1471> whither I have scattered<WH6327> thee<WH6213>, but I will not make a full end<WH3617> of thee<WH3256>; but I will correct thee in measure<WH4941>, and will in no wise leave<WH5352> thee unpunished<WH5352>.
For thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Thy hurt<WH7667> is incurable<WH605>, and thy wound<WH4347> grievous<WH2470>.
There is none to plead<WH1777> thy cause<WH1779>, that thou mayest be bound up<WH4205>: thou hast no healing<WH8585> medicines<WH7499>.

All thy lovers<WH157> have forgotten<WH7911> thee<WH1875>; they seek thee not<WH5221>: for I have wounded thee with the wound<WH4347> of an enemy<WH341>, with the chastisement<WH4148> of a cruel one<WH394>, for the greatness<WH7230> of thine iniquity<WH5771>, because thy sins<WH2403> were increased<WH6105>.

Why criest<WH2199> thou for thy hurt<WH7667>? thy pain<WH4341> is incurable<WH605>: for the greatness<WH7230> of thine iniquity<WH5771>, because thy sins<WH2403> were increased<WH6105>, I have done these things unto thee<WH6213>.

Therefore all they that devour<WH398> thee shall be devoured<WH398>; and all thine adversaries<WH6862>, every one of them<WH3212>, shall go into captivity<WH7628>; and they that despoil<WH7601> thee shall be a spoil<WH4933>, and all that prey<WH962> upon thee will I give<WH5414> for a prey<WH957>.

For I will restore<WH5927> health<WH724> unto thee<WH7495>, and I will heal thee of thy wounds<WH4347>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; because they have called<WH7121> thee an outcast<WH5080>, saying<WH6726>, It is Zion, whom no man seeketh after<WH1875>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: Behold<WH7725>, I will turn again the captivity<WH7622> of Jacob<WH3290>'s tents<WH168>, and have compassion<WH7355> on his dwelling-places<WH4908>; and the city<WH5892> shall be builded<WH1129> upon its own hill<WH8510>, and the palace<WH759> shall be inhabited<WH3427> after its own manner<WH4941>.

And out of them shall proceed<WH3318> thanksgiving<WH8426> and the voice<WH6963> of them that make merry<WH7832>: and I will multiply<WH7235> them<WH4591>, and they shall not be few; I will also glorify<WH3513> them<WH6819>, and they shall not be small.
Their children<WH1121> also shall be as aforetime<WH6924>, and their congregation<WH5712> shall be established<WH3559> before<WH6440> me<WH6485>; and I will punish all that oppress them<WH3905>.

And their prince<WH117> shall be of themselves<WH4910>, and their ruler shall proceed<WH3318> from the midst<WH7130> of them<WH7126>; and I will cause him to draw near, and he shall approach<WH5066> unto me<WH6148>: for who is he that hath had boldness<WH3820> to approach<WH5066> unto me<WH5002>? saith Jehovah<WH3068>.
And ye shall be my people<WH5971>, and I will be your God<WH430>.
Behold <WH5591>, the tempest of Jehovah<WH3068>, even his wrath<WH2534>, is gone forth<WH3318>, a sweeping<WH1641> tempest<WH5591>: it shall burst<WH2342> upon the head<WH7218> of the wicked<WH7563>.

The fierce<WH2740> anger<WH639> of Jehovah<WH3068> shall not return<WH7725>, until he have executed<WH6213>, and till he have performed<WH6965> the intents<WH4209> of his heart<WH3820>: in the latter<WH319> days<WH3117> ye shall understand it<WH995>.
